title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1.11 - Executive Order No. 11: [Continuing Order No. 10.]
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1.11 - Executive Order No. 11: [Continuing Order No. 10.]
State Regulations
WHEREAS, On September eighth, nineteen hundred sixty-two, I, Nelson A. Rockefeller, Governor of the State of New York, did make a certain
order constituting Herman T. Stichman as a Special Commissioner to investigate, examine and inquire into certain matters, all of which are more particularly
described in said order and which order is hereby incorporated herein and made
a part hereof as if herein set forth in full, and did in said order direct the

Attorney General of the State to inquire into the matters described in said
order involving the public peace, public safety and public justice, and did
request the Attorney General to do so by appointing the Special Commissioner as
a Special Assistant Attorney General; and
WHEREAS, It appearing to be in the public interest that the
investigation, examination and inquiry conducted pursuant to said order should
be continued; NOW, THEREFORE, Pursuant to the Constitution and the
provisions of Section
6
and Section
63, Subdivision
8, of the Executive

Law, I do hereby continue the constitution of Herman T. Stichman as a Special

Commissioner to investigate, examine and inquire into the matters described in
said order, and do hereby direct the Attorney General to continue to inquire
into the matters described in said order involving the public peace, public
safety and public justice, and do hereby request the Attorney General to do so
by continuing the appointment of the Special Commissioner as a Special

Assistant Attorney General, and do hereby direct that said investigation, examination and inquiry, and the powers and duties incident thereto, continue
to be conducted according to law and according to the directions and provisions
of said order. Signed: Nelson A. Rockefeller

Dated: January 1, 1963

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
1.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
